newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sinar, Singapore CISCO in security deal.
newsitem.headline: Sinar, Singapore CISCO in security deal.

text.p: Singapore's leading security company, CISCO, has formed a joint venture with Indonesia's PT Sinar Mas Multiartha to provide commercial security services in Indonesia, CISCO said on Monday.
The new company, PT CISCO Mas Security, is 60 percent owned by PT Sinar Mas and 40 percent by CISCO, and will have an initial investment of Singapore $2 million.
PT CISCO Mas will begin operations in early 1997 and will provide a full range of commercial security services to banks and departments stores in Jakarta.
It plans to expand operations to other regional capitals such as Surabaya, Medan and Bandung after two years.

The project is CISCO's third foreign venture. CISCO is owned by the Singapore government and for the fiscal year 1995/1996 it repored group sales of S$110.6 million with an operating surplus of S$14.2 million.
CISCO's other investments are in Beijing and Sri Lanka.
PT Sinar Mas Multiartha is part of Indonesia's Sinar Mas conglomerate.
